description:
Zeid Ra’ad Al Hussein, United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights, and Sam Altman, president of Y Combinator and co-chairman of OpenAI, explore potential benefits and adverse impacts of both narrow and general artificial intelligence. Moderated by GDPi’s Executive Director, Eileen Donahoe, the conversation ranged from the future of work and universal basic income to the importance of a common lexicon between technologists and human rights experts. Other topics include the human rights implications of AI in developing countries and integrating human rights norms with the day-to-day work of technologists.
 
Human-Centered AI, June 11, 2018 | Stanford University | Hosted by Stanford's Global Digital Policy Incubator and the XPRIZE Foundation
 
Follow Stanford GDPi on Twitter: https://twitter.com/Stanford_GDPi 
Read our blog-posts: https://medium.com/stanfords-gdpi 
Visit our website: https://cddrl.fsi.stanford.edu/global-digital-policy-incubator/front-global-digital-policy-incubator
title: Panel: AI & Human Rights| Zeid Ra'ad Al Hussein & Sam Altman| "Human-Centered AI" June 11, 2018
